summary: An independent financial condition report prepared by Macalvins Limited for Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team, covering the period 2015-2020. It details her assets, net worth, property sales, trust transfers, and charitable activities, concluding her net worth was approximately $22.5 million as of October 2020, with no significant alienation of assets.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of the financial report, accused
persons.context: The central subject of the financial condition report detailing her assets, net worth, property transactions, and trust transfers from 2015 to 2020.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Associate, source of earlier financial transfers
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of government allegations of substantial financial transfers between his accounts and Ghislaine Maxwell's accounts during 2007-2011, and as the source of a donation to her charity.

connections.description: The report references government allegations of transfers totaling over $20 million between their accounts in 2007-2011, and notes a $57,000 donation from Epstein's foundation to Maxwell's charity in 2013.

events.title: Sale of New York City Property
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell sold a residential property in New York City for $15,075,000. The proceeds were deposited into a UBS account of 116 E 65th LLC and later used to purchase other properties.

events.title: Marriage and Asset Transfer to Trust
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell married her spouse and began filing joint tax returns. She transferred the majority of her assets into a trust controlled by her spouse and her sister.

events.title: Dissolution of Terramar Charities
events.description: Both Terramar Project Inc (US) and Terramar UK Ltd, charities founded by Ghislaine Maxwell, ceased operations and were dissolved.

events.title: Reported Net Worth Snapshot
events.description: The report estimates Ghislaine Maxwell and her spouse's combined net worth to be approximately $22,500,000, including about $7.67 million in advance legal retainer fees.

locations: New York City (location of sold property)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's net worth was approximately $20.2 million in January 2015 and estimated at $22.5 million in October 2020.
In 2015, she sold a New York City residential property for $15,075,000, with proceeds tracked through accounts at UBS and other banks.
In 2016, she married and transferred most of her assets into a trust controlled by her spouse and her sister.
The report states there was no significant alienation of assets from 2015-2020, aside from ordinary living expenses and substantial legal defense fees since 2019.
The report addresses and disputes earlier government allegations of large transfers between Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, stating no such transfers were noted in the 2015-2020 review period.
